Sentencas: The carbon amounts of simulated syngases with different compositions were calculated in this study.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: The degradation and carbon deposition behavior of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) with an active area of 4 cm x 4 cm were then investigated under the simulated syngases at work conditions.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: Carbon deposition occurred over time with a little or no H2O and CO2 in these gasses, which significantly degraded the single cells.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: The cell stabilized within 1 h under a gas mixture of 70 % H-2-30 % CO because of the chocking of inlet pipelines of the testing house by carbon deposition.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: Addition of proper H2O and CO2 in the simulated syngas effectively suppressed carbon deposition in the pipelines.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: However, carbon was still deposited gradually in the single cell anode when H2O and CO2 were insufficient.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: The mechanisms of carbon deposition were different when the cells were exposed under different syngases.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases

Sentencas: Single cells steadily thrived under 50 % H-2-20 % CO-10 % CO2-20 % H2O and 50 % H-2-20 % CO-20 % CO2-10 % H2O gas mixtures for about 2000 h without carbon deposition.
Titulo: Behavior of anode-supported SOFCs under simulated syngases
